remarks: Definition of the predicate that determines if some class ` F ` is defined as function for an argument ` A ` or, in other words, if the function value for some class ` F ` for an argument ` A ` is defined.  We say that ` F ` is defined at ` A ` if a ` F ` is a function restricted to the member ` A ` of its domain.  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 25-May-2017.)
statement: df-dfat $p |- ( F defAt A <-> ( A e. dom F /\ Fun ( F |` { A } ) ) ) $.
